Multicore Computing

Source: vignettes/multicore.Rmd
multicore.Rmd
library(PETLER)
## Loading required package: survival
library(ggplot2)
TrainCode <- data_org$TrainCode
TrainCode[, monthstd := month / fu_time]  
TrainCode
##            id  fu_time month pred1 pred2 pred3  monthstd
##      1:     1 49.41273     0     0     0     0 0.0000000
##      2:     1 49.41273     1     0     0     0 0.0202377
##      3:     1 49.41273     2     0     0     0 0.0404754
##      4:     1 49.41273     3     0     0     0 0.0607131
##      5:     1 49.41273     4     0     0     0 0.0809508
##     ---                                                 
## 810620: 20600 24.70637    20     0     0     0 0.8095080
## 810621: 20600 24.70637    21     0     0     0 0.8499834
## 810622: 20600 24.70637    22     0     0     0 0.8904588
## 810623: 20600 24.70637    23     0     0     1 0.9309342
## 810624: 20600 24.70637    24     0     0     2 0.9714096
colSums(TrainCode[, 4:6])
##  pred1  pred2  pred3 
## 165843  67354  19437
timing <- function(code, ngrid, n_core) {
  x <- seq(0, 1, length.out = ngrid)  
  pred <- TrainCode[[code]]
  TrainNP <- pred[pred > 0] 
  t <- rep(TrainCode$monthstd, pred)
  h1 <- bw.nrd(t)
  h2 <- bw.nrd(t)^(5/6)  
  system.time(FPC.Kern.S(x, t, TrainNP, h1, h2, n_core = n_core))["elapsed"]
}
DF <- expand.grid(
  codes = paste0("pred", 1:3), 
  ngrid =  c(100, 200, 400) + 1, 
  n_core = c(1, 2, 4),
  time = NA)
for (i in 1:nrow(DF))  {
  code <- as.character(DF$code[i])
  DF$time[i] <- timing(code, DF$ngrid[i], DF$n_core[i])
}
saveRDS(DF, "multicore.rds")
ggplot(DF, aes(x = factor(n_core), y = time)) + 
  facet_grid(paste("ngrid =", ngrid) ~ codes) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") + theme_bw() +
  xlab("Number of CPU Cores") + ylab("Elapsed Time (seconds)")
